summary: Lucas Moran was a representative of the Movimiento Democrata Cristiano in Cuba. Letters were sent to him in this capacity, as indicated by a dispatch from the Chief of Base, JHWAVE, to Chief, WRD. The documents suggest that Moran was involved in activities related to the Movimiento Democrata Cristiano, and that correspondence with him was of interest to the CIA, specifically JMWAVE. There is concern about protecting the source of information related to Moran, indicated by the implementation of SECRET NOFORN controls on materials from AMULLA-1.
significance: Lucas Moran's significance in the JFK context is indirect. He appears to be a contact or representative of the Movimiento Democrata Cristiano in Cuba, an organization that was of interest to the CIA. The documents suggest that the CIA was monitoring correspondence with Moran, indicating potential involvement in anti-Castro activities. The connection to the Movimiento Democrata Cristiano and the CIA's interest in his activities may be relevant to understanding the broader context of US-Cuban relations and anti-Castro efforts during the period leading up to the JFK assassination.
